text:
(1)
East Street, east side, at Grand Street. Towering over the old Grand Street Ferry, is the Williamsburg Bridge, projecting eastward over the East River, to the Williamsburg section of the Borough of Kings (Brooklyn).
March 24, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a different angle.
March 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East Street, east side, at Grand Street. The view shows the Municipal Ferry to Broadway, brooklyn, at the eastern end of Grand Street, and a portion of the Williamsburg Bridge.

April 9, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view of the ferry building's proper.

March 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
East Street, east side, north from Grand Street.  Shown is the Williamsburg Bridge, projecting eastward over the East River, to the Williamsburg section of the Borough of Kings (Brooklyn).

April 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a different angle.

March 31, 1929.

(1) East Street, east side, at the foot of Grand Street. The view shows the deck housing of the sunken "Lexington" at the old Grand Street Ferry Slip. January 4, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, in the opposite direction and showing a view westward on Grand Street. Towered building shown with clock (center) is the R. Hoe and Co. plant. March 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) A general view of the ferry and surrounding area, as seen from the deck of the ferry boat "Herman Bruckner." Note the Williamsburg Bridge on the right. March 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) A view south on East Street from Broome Street, showing the remains of the old Ferry House that was destroyed by fire about Christmas 1928. March 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)

title: Demolition of Louis Greenberg Plumbing Supplies: 615-625 Grand St.-East St., Manhattan
Demolition of Louis Greenberg Plumbing Supplies: 618-628 Grand St.- East St., Manhattan

text:
(1) East Street, east side, at the eastern extremity of Grand Street. View shows demolishment of the former Grand Street Ferry.

September 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, a closer view. Note Williamsburg Bridge in the background.

September 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 1.
